text: hi everyone crack the knee kurtano here
the internet's busiest music nerd and
it's time for a review of the new
Gorillaz album cracker Island yeah this
is the newest full-length LP from
legendary virtual band gorillas 2D and
the Gang are back with their first
studio album offering since 2020 song
machine song machine season one mind you
I'm sure the second season is due
any day now
any day
I'm tired of waiting either way song
machine was a great fun extravagant and
colorful collection of songs that
celebrated The Eclectic dynamics of
gorillas and also featured some of their
best collaborations and crossovers to
date cracker Island however isn't so
much a loose collection of bangers as
that record was this thing is more of a
concept record in terms of sound and
narrative it seems to be another
destination album as well because years
ago we were once invited to a Plastic
Beach and now with this record we are
hopping on a jet ski to a cracker Island
whose General culture and Vibe is
described in quite a bit of detail on
the opening title track with references
to it being a made-up Paradise with
distorted truths cult Behavior occult
Behavior as Stephen Hawking once
famously said in that Simpsons episode I
wanted to see her Utopia but now I see
it is more of a Fruitopia there's some
great production on this track 2 with
some bright textured synth leads a
discotheque Baseline fat and driving
dance grooves and a very colorful vocal
feature from the one and only Thundercat
it's a bold and great introduction to
this new world that for some reason
takes a surprisingly Bland nosedive
right away with the song oil which
sounds like a really Airy and Toothless
piece of synth pop with a super static
beat I'm also surprised that the Stevie
Nicks feature on this thing isn't much
more than a background vocal because her
voice and presence could have easily
lent itself to something much bigger and
more dramatic especially on a record
trying to characterize such a dreamy
dystopia still I do like the World
building going on in the lyrics on the
track but I think things take an even
more boring turn on the following the
tired influencer whose instrumental
sounds like an overpriced cruise I don't
really want to be on and lyrically on
this thing of course we get a lot of uh
very on the nose influencer commentary
we're living in a cracked screen World
frankly even though the chorus Melody on
this track is pretty good I found
gorillas to touch down on this topic a
lot more effectively with some of the
content on song machine this just feels
like a lesser revisit however following
this track we have the single Silent
Running which I do enjoy quite a bit
even if it sounds like Damon Albarn is
kind of fishing for the most focused
grouped gorillas hit ever here the track
aesthetically feels really airbrushed
smooth not so much of the cartoony and
creative Antics sonically speaking we
typically expect from a gorilla song
between the Glamorous pianos the
pristine Reverb on the vocals as well as
the whistles in the background this
thing sounds like something from the
mainstream Indie wave of the 2000s I
kinda enjoy the raw piano version of the
track a bit more that's featured on the
deluxe edition of the record but at the
very least the song does reinforce the
continued Narrative of being isolated
and searching for a new world next we
get another single from the record new
gold featuring team Impala as well as
booty Brown I wasn't crazy about this
when I first heard it I'm still not that
into it really it comes down to a couple
of things one the booty Brown feature is
not great disappointing frankly and not
the level of presentation performance
and lyricism I expect from a veteran of
the game the rhyme schemes and level of
wit are giving more amateur rapper than
they are founding member of The Far Side
plus the instrumental just sounds like a
Tame Impala song with a disco beat it's
really one of my least favorite gorilla
singles to date and what's funny is that
it doesn't even sound that much like a
gorilla's song The Narrative dream
sequences on this thing continue on to
the track baby Queen at this point
cracker island is almost giving me the
easy going Vibes of 2018's the now now
all over again but still the song does
feature an interesting perspective on a
real life experience that Damon Albarn
had back in the day meeting the princess
of Thailand in the 90s as he was still a
part of the bad blur he dreams about
meeting her again much later in life and
what exactly this means isn't really
explained but again I suppose it does
contribute to the dreamy tapestry the
record is weaving together tarantula is
a groovy disco influence cut with some
lovesick lyrics on the chorus the beat
and Melodies are nice but once again
even though I enjoy the song at the core
of this track the Aesthetics of this
song instrumentally just come off really
washed out meanwhile tormenta featuring
Bad Bunny feels like I am being taken to
a tropical island vacation at gunpoint
as gorillas make an awkward attempt at
delivering some reggaeton music that
doesn't go over super great I guess I
get what Damon was going for with the
very thin toy type instrumentation on
the verses than the very thick and Lush
choruses But ultimately both sides of
this coin I think are missing something
and while the Bad Bunny feature is fine
it doesn't exactly save the track then
skinny ape is maybe my favorite track on
the entire project and one of the more
creative and surprising gorilla songs of
all time feels pretty bad out of place
on this record too weirdly with the
super rustic acoustic intro which builds
up into a loud thick thrilling Lo-Fi
finale it feels like this is what you
would get if Neutral Milk Hotel made
synth pop skin a little skinny little
skinny little skinny little
but contrast this with the closer
possession featuring Beck which I think
is one of the most tedious ballads to
end up on any gorilla's record it
reminds me of something from one of
Damon's very gray and dull solo records
even if there is a message of Hope and
unity at the core of the track and once
again like with Stevie Nicks earlier on
the record I just don't really see what
Beck brings to this track vocally other
than just a little bit of background
color I think his placement I think his
inclusion it could have been a lot more
interesting the track doesn't really do
too much for me outside of the a very
triumphant trumpet passages toward the
very end yeah this gorilla's album
overall while I didn't hate it I wasn't
crazy about it either for sure I can
commend it for B being somewhat of a
concept A Portrait an idea but it's kind
of a dreamy flavorless meager one and
doesn't really dig that deeply into its
Central Point its most obvious themes
make the obvious comparison to an
earlier record like Plastic Beach which
is so much more colorful so much more
well produced well written and immersive
if that record for gorillas is the
definition of exploring a new world this
is more of a weekend getaway at a time
share I'm feeling a light two decent six
on this one transition have you given
this album a listen did you love it did
you hate it what would you rate it
you're the best you're the best what
should I review next hit the like if you
like Please Subscribe and please don't
cry hit the Bell as well over here next
to my head is another video you can
check out hit that up or the link to
subscribe to the channel gorillas
cracker Island forever
